de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.model
Interface Model

All Known Implementing Classes:
ModelImpl
public interface Model

Model interface is the signature for a particular implementation of the model. The listed methods have to be supported at least. And to notify the view layer that data has changed, we also provide an observable model.

Because the model is only observable, it doesn't mean we have allow direct access to the model layer. But with notification we tell the view, that it has to get the latest updates via the controller layer.

Notification goes from the model directly to the view. But on the other side, the view has only access via the controller.

Since:
Mar/24/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Method Detail

setResource

void setResource(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage)
here is the Ecore meta model stored. Which is loaded from outside the system. We parse it via the EMF Framework and build our own model out of that.

Parameters:
ePackage - EMF Ecore meta model

getResource

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage getResource()
gets the Ecore meta model.

Returns:
EPackage

addArtefact

void addArtefact(Artefact artefact)
sets the artefact, which is a customized model of the EMF Ecore model. We use that to generate test data sets, because it's easier to extend and to modify.

Notice, that this is a wrapper for all artefacts. It holds all supported types at one place, but in disjunct sets.

Parameters:
artefact - creates a new artefact set, which holds all artefacts of one type.

getArtefacts

java.util.List<Artefact> getArtefacts()
gets the artefacts data structure which is a customized model of the EMF Ecore model. We use that to generate test data sets, because it's easier to extend and to modify.

Notice, that this is a wrapper for all artefacts. It holds all supported types at one place, but in disjunct sets.

Returns:
all artefacts

getArtefact

Artefact getArtefact(ArtefactType artefactType)
gets an collection of artefacts by specifying the type. That's possible, because each artefact type has it's own collection of artefacts.

Parameters:
artefactType - the type of artefacts to access
Returns:
collection of artefacts specified by type

iteratorArtefact

java.util.Iterator<Artefact> iteratorArtefact()
gets an iterator for artefacts.

Returns:
iterator of artefacts.

addArtefactType

void addArtefactType(ArtefactType artefactType)
sets an new artefact type into model layer. They're later displayed, when EMF Ecore models loaded and the data has to be linked with an artefact type.

Artefact types split up the set of test data.

Parameters:
artefactType - holds the name of an artefact type

getArtefactType

ArtefactType getArtefactType(java.lang.String name)
tries to find an artefact type by name. If its found it's returned, otherwise null.

Parameters:
name - name of artefact type
Returns:
artefact type or null

iteratorArtefactType

java.util.Iterator<ArtefactType> iteratorArtefactType()
Returns an iterator over the elements in this list in proper sequence.

Returns:
iterator of artefact types.

getArtefactTypes

java.util.List<ArtefactType> getArtefactTypes()
gets the list of supported artefact types. At any time there are as much collections as artefact types.

Returns:
list of artefact types.

getNoOfAttributesInTotal

int getNoOfAttributesInTotal()
backtracks the total amount of facets hold in data structure. Note, this number is in the model layer. And do not confuse it with the counter in artefact collections.

Returns:
number of attributes (global)

getNoOfClassesInTotal

int getNoOfClassesInTotal()
keeps track of total meta classes over all artefact collections. Note, this number is in model layer. But there are also counter in the collections itself.

Returns:
number of classes (global)

setUnits

void setUnits(java.util.List<Unit> units)
sets the units. An initial set of units can be found in the startup.xml file.

Parameters:
units - list of units

addUnit

adds an unit element to the list.

Parameters:
unit - unit element

java.util.List<Unit> getUnits()

list of units

java.util.Iterator<Unit> iteratorUnits()
Returns an iterator over the elements in this list in proper sequence.

Returns:
iterator for units

addGenerator

void addGenerator(Generator generator)
adds a generator to the model layer. This method is called by controller layer.

Parameters:
generator - a generator to store in model layer.

removeGenerator

void removeGenerator(Generator generator)
removes a generator from the data structure. This happens usually, when the controller unregister a generator.

Parameters:
generator - a generator is removed, when controller unregisters it.

addProbabilityDistribution

void addProbabilityDistribution(ProbabilityDistribution distribution)
adds a new probability distribution to the model layer. Note, this method can only be called by controller layer.

Parameters:
distribution - a probability distribution to add

removeProbabilityDistribution

void removeProbabilityDistribution(ProbabilityDistribution distribution)
removes a probability distribution from the model layer.

Parameters:
distribution - probability distribution to take off from list.

print

void print()
only for debugging and testing purposes.

With this method the complete set of artefacts are printed to standard console.
